exam.question: Some researchers feel that certain people have nervous systems particularly ______ to hot, dry winds. They are what we call weather-sensitive people.

answer.explain: be/have vulnerable to： 易受…影响的。句意： 一些研究人员发现某些人的神经系统特别会受干燥的热风的影响； 我们称那些人为天气敏感症患者。subjective： 主观的； subordinate： 次要的； liable： 有…倾向的。

sentences.sContent: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.sCn: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.sContent: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.sCn: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

sentences.sContent: ...sex and background Some groups of people are more vulnerable to the illness...

...There must urgently be a meaningful mobilization of the policies outlined in the agreement if we are to achieve national emissions reductions while helping the most vulnerable countries adapt to climate change...
...Personal information on credit and debit cards is increasingly vulnerable to hacking...
...prisoners will be released early and schemes to protect the vulnerable will be rolled back...
...children are especially vulnerable to this kind of bias...
...Are cities and towns less safe and kids more vulnerable to crimes like child kidnap and sexual abuse than they were in previous generations...

synos.tran: 易受攻击的，易受…的攻击；易受伤害的；有弱点的

trans.tranCn: 易受伤的， 脆弱的； 易受攻击的， 难防御的
trans.tranOther: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt
